title: A Massive Effort Called STURP
post:
I think we, before investigating on many (interesting)
miracles … and other phenomena .. we should improve
knowledges that can be useful for our research
about the Shroud.
For example, here a case…
I have read that:
>MALDI-IMS involves the visualization of
the spatial distribution of proteins, peptides, lipids,
and other small molecules within thin slices of tissue,
such as animal or plant.
So… the question to pose is the following:
Is it possible to work on linen fibrils with MALDI-IMS
(Link:  https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MALDI_imaging )
in order to detect (in an exact manner) the molecules
and the degree of polymerization of cellulose and lignin?
In my idea the answer is: not.
What is your opinion?
How to deepen the analyses on that “textile mystery”?
author: piero
